metadata.Title: CVE-2022-39347 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affected versions of FreeRDP are missing path canonicalization and base path check for `drive` channel. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to read files outside the shared directory. This issue has been addressed in version 2.9.0 and all users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade should not use the `/drive`, `/drives` or `+home-drive` redirection switch.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-39347` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.3
freerdp2-wayland - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.3
freerdp2-x11 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.3
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.3
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.3
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.3
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.3
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.3
libuwac0-0 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.3
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.3
libwinpr2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.3
winpr-utils - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> malicious server could read arbitrary files

criterions.comment: freerdp2 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.3').
